content:
• Tuesday, January 30, 2018
  • FIT

    Fitbit up 1.9% as Stifel bumps to Hold

    • After a flat regular-market session (a positive outcome in a market like today's), Fitbit (NYSE:FIT) has ticked up 1.9% after hours after getting an upgrade to Hold at Stifel Nicolaus.
    • The stock was a Sell. Analyst Jim Duffy has updated his price target on the stock to $5.50, from a previous $6.
    • That implies just under 6% upside from today's close of $5.20.
    • Shares have fallen 28% over a roller-coaster 12 months; they're nearly flat over the past six months.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM | 133 Comments
  • KNX

    Knight-Swift +8% after Q4 earnings beat; expects higher freight rates

    • Knight-Swift Transportation (NYSE:KNX) +8.1% after-hours following an easy Q4 earnings beat, and the recently merged trucking company says it expects higher contract rates for the freight it carries this year.
    • “Given the strength in the freight market and the inflationary pressures the industry is experiencing in driver wages, we expect to see rate increases in our contract business in the high single digits to low double digits throughout 2018,” CEO Dave Jackson said during the company's earnings conference call.
    • But the driver shortage remains a challenge for the industry and likely will hurt the ability to increase capacity, Jackson said, adding that driver wages rose 6%-7% in Q4 amid “some pent-up wage pressure” after two years of small or no pay bumps.
    • KNX says it plans net capex of $525M-$575M for 2018 as it moves away from leasing equipment.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM
  • XRX

    Xerox +7.1% on report Fujifilm deal could come tomorrow (updated)

    • Xerox (NYSE:XRX) shares have jumped 7.1% after hours on a Dow Jones report that it's near a deal with Fujifilm (OTCPK:FUJIY) as soon as tomorrow.
    • That would leave current Xerox shareholders with less than half of the new company. Fuji Xerox, the joint venture between the two, would own 51% of Xerox.
    • Reports earlier this month signaled a major deal between the two that could result in a change of control. And major investors Carl Icahn and Darwin Deason have pushed the company to explore a sale and break its JV with Fujifilm, along with pressure to fire CEO Jeff Jacobson.
    • Updated: Xerox shareholders would get an implied premium for their stock and cash, according to the full report. And Xerox shares would continue trading afterward if the transaction is done.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMMR

    Immersion adds to gains on license deal with Marquardt

    • Immersion (NASDAQ:IMMR) has gained 7.7% in the postmarket session, adding on to 7.4% gains during market hours, after it noted a new multi-year license deal with electronic switch maker Marquardt.
    • The deal gives Marquardt access to Immersion's patented TouchSense haptics for use in automotive solutions.
    • That news comes a day after the stock logged gains of more than 30% after the company reached a settlement with Apple.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM
  • SYK

    Stryker -3.2% after earnings, flat guidance

    • Stryker (NYSE:SYK) is 3.2% lower postmarket after it logged Q4 earnings that beat analyst expectations but signaled guidance just below the midpoint of expectations.
    • Net sales were up 10% (and 8.7% in constant currency), with strongest growth in the Neurotechnology and Spine segment, in line with its pre-announcement.
    • Meanwhile, reported EPS swung to a loss or $0.66, alongside a charge for the impact of tax reform, among other adjustments. Adjusted EPS rose 10.1% to $1.96.
    • Excluding the impact of tax reform and other effects, gross profit margin rises to 66.4% from 64.5%.
    • Sales by segment: Orthopaedics, $1.305B (up 8.1%); MedSurg, $1.58B (up 10.9%); Neurotechnology and Spine, $586M (up 11.5%).
    • For 2018, it expects organic sales growth of 6%-6.5%, and adjusted net earnings per share of $1.57-$1.62 for Q1 (vs. consensus for $1.60) and $7.07-$7.17 for the full year (vs. $7.13 consensus).
    • 8-K filing
     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM | 5 Comments
  • SMCI

    Super Micro -12.8% after preliminary results, CFO resignation

    • Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ:SMCI) has turned lower by 12.8% after it posted preliminary Q2 results that also noted an executive exodus.
    • The company's chief financial officer, Howard Hideshima, has resigned, along with Senior VP of International Sales Wally Liaw and Senior VP of Worldwide Sales Phidias Chou.
    • Those moves are effective immediately. Liaw also resigned from the board.
    • Kevin Bauer has been named senior VP and chief financial officer, and Don Clegg has been named to succeed Chou as an interim worldwide sales leader.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM | 11 Comments
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly +17% after Q4 earnings beat, Lifetouch acquisition

    • Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) +17.1% after-hours as it easily beats Q4 earnings and revenue estimates and agrees to acquire privately-held photography company Lifetouch for $825M.
    • Lifetouch photographs 25M-plus children annually during the fall picture day tradition, serving more than 10M households, and amassed nearly $964M in revenue and $111M in EBITDA  for the fiscal year ended June 30, 2017.
    • For FY 2018, SFLY foresees EPS of $1.94-$2.38 on revenues of $1.22B-$1.26B, surpassing analyst consensus for $1.50 EPS and $1.21B in revenues, with gross profit margin of 48.5%-49.5% of net revenues.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • MYSZ

    MySize -14.6% on news of offering for shares, warrants

    • MySize (NASDAQ:MYSZ) has slid 14.6% after hours on heavy volume, on word that it's setting a public offering for its common share and warrants.
    • It's not yet set size or terms of the offering, but plans to use proceeds for general purposes.
    • Roth Capital is its sole placement agent.
    • Shares had gained 6.2% during the regular session today to close at $2.40.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM | 5 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers (1/30/2018)

    • Top gainers: SFLY +16.8%. IMMR +6.3%. EA +6.6%. CA +2.9%. MOD +2.8%.
    • Top losers: CERS -8.4%. JNPR -7.2%. LPI -2.9%. CRNT -2.7%. CB -2.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • BX

    Thomson Reuters approves sale of financial data business to Blackstone

    • Blackstone (NYSE:BX) is getting into financial data in a big way, with a confirmed deal to take control of the Financial & Risk business from Thomson Reuters (NYSE:TRI).
    • A consortium led by Blackstone including its private-equity funds along with the Canada Pension Paln Investment Board and GIC have entered a deal to take 55% of a new corporation made to hold the business.
    • Thomson Reuters will hold its 45% equity stake, as previously reported, and Blackstone will begin competing with Bloomberg and Dow Jones (NWS, NWSA).
    • The deal values the unit at about $20B; Blackstone was reported to be paying about $4B in cash along with $13B financed by new debt taken on by the partnership.
    • After hours: BX -0.6%; TRI +1.3%.
    • Previously: Reuters: Blackstone's buyout offer includes annual payments to news unit (Jan. 30 2018)
    • Previously: Report: Blackstone discussing $17B bid for control of Thomson Reuters unit (Jan. 29 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 6 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD down despite Q4 beats, upside guidance

    • Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) shares are down 0.4% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Upside Q1 guidance: revenue, $1.5B to $1.6B (consensus: $1.24B); non-GAAP gross margin, 36%. Note that AMD's guidance is under the new ASC 606 revenue accounting standard and may not be directly comparable to consensus estimates.
    • FY18 guidance has double-digit percent growth in annual revenue (11.6% growth consensus) and non-GAAP gross margin over 36%.
    • Computing and Graphics performance: Sales totaled $958M (+60% Y/Y) driven by strong Radeon and Ryzen sales. Client ASP increased on the year but flat on the quarter due to increase in desktop processor ASP. GPU ASP was up on the year and sequentially driven by desktop and professional graphics processors.
    • Enterprise, Embedded and Semi-Custom performance: Revenue was $522M (+3% Y/Y; - 37% Q/Q) with the increase driven by server revenue and the decrease due to seasonally lower semi-custom SoC revenue.
    • Key results: Cost of sales, $965M; gross margin, 35% (+3 percentage points Y/Y); R&D spend, $300M (-$15M Y/Y); MG&A spend, $133M (+$1M Y/Y); cash and cash equivalents, $1.18B.
    • Press release 
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Previously: Advanced Micro Devices beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Jan. 30)
    • Update: Post updated to include accounting change in the guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 69 Comments
  • BLCM

    Bellicum Pharmaceuticals set for big down move on BPX-501 clinical hold

    • Bellicum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BLCM) will be under substantial selling pressure when trading resumes following its announcement that the FDA has instituted a clinical hold on all U.S. studies evaluating cell therapy candidate BPX-501. The agency took action after three cases of encephalopathy were reported.
    • Trading will resume at 5:15 pm ET.
    • Previously: Bellicum's lead product candidate continues to show positive treatment effect in early-stage study; shares ahead 10% premarket (Feb. 23, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 33 Comments
  • AVXS

    Screening to continue in AveXis' pivot trial of AVXS-101 in SMA Type 1; shares down 4% after hours

    • AveXis (NASDAQ:AVXS) will initiate screening of the remaining patients in its pivotal clinical trial, STR1VE, evaluating lead candidate AVXS-101 in patients with spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) Type 1.
    • The company received the thumbs up from the FDA after the agency reviewed the safety data on the first three patients. The study will enroll at least 15 subjects.
    • Shares are down 4% after hours on what appears to be profit-taking after today's runup.
    • Previously: AveXis expands clinical development program for AVXS-101 (Jan. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper Networks -6.1% as Q1 guidance disappoints

    • Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR) has slid 6.1% after hours following a preliminary Q4 earnings report where financials came in ahead of expectations but Q1 guidance indiated deployment delays.
    • In Q1, the company expects large cloud customers to continue an architectural transition "which is expected to result in below normal seasonality." Beyond that, it expects revenue to grow sequentially and return to Y/Y growth by the end of the year.
    • It's forecasting revenues of $1.02B-$1.08B (light of expectations for $1.156B) and EPS of $0.22-$0.28 (below consensus for $0.42).
    • Q4 revenues fell 1% sequentially and 11% Y/Y to $1.24B, with GAAP net loss widening to $148.1M mainly due to tax reform, which added some $289.5M in tax expense.
    • On a non-GAAP basis, net income fell 22% Y/Y to $199.4M.
    • Conference call to come at 5p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 8 Comments
  • CA

    CA Technologies +5.5% after Q3 beats, upside FY18 guidance

    • CA Technologies (NASDAQ:CA) shares are up 5.5% aftermarket following Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Upside FY18 guidance: revenue, $4.22B to $4.25B (consensus: $4.22B); EPS, $2.54 to $2.60 (raised from $2.42 to $2.48; consensus: $2.46); non-GAAP operating margin, 36% to 37%; non-GAAP effective tax rate, 25% (was: 29%); cash flow, $1.1B to $1.15B. 
    • Segment Sales: Mainframe Solutions, $552M (flat Y/Y constant currency); Enterprise Solutions, $461M (+16%); Services, $80M (+9%).   
    • Bookings: Total bookings decreased due to decline in renewal booking. North American Bookings were $718M (-11% Y/Y in constant currency), International Bookings were $410M (-14%), and Total Bookings were $1.13B (-12%). 
    • License agreements: CA executed 13 license agreements with incremental contract values over $10M each in the quarter for an aggregate contract value of $367M, which compares to the 21 contracts and $577M value in the prior year’s period.
    • Key metrics: Cash flow from operations, $315M (-41% Y/Y in constant currency); non-GAAP operating margin, 38% (flat); effective tax rate, 18.4% (-10.1 percentage points); cash and equivalents, $2.97B; total debt outstanding, $2.79B.    
    • Press release 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern Time with webcast available here. 
    • Previously: CA Technologies beats by $0.15, beats on revenue (Jan. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • VICL

    Vical to restructure, 54% staff reduction, funding for ASP0113 axed; shares down 3% after hours

    • Aimed at extending its cash runway to fund development of its HSV-2 vaccine and antifungal VL-2397, Vical (NASDAQ:VICL) initiates a restructuring plan that includes the elimination 54% (40 jobs) of its workforce. In addition, all funding for Astellas-licensed ASP0113 will be terminated.
    • The company ended 2017 with $60M - 65M in cash. It will record a $1.1M charge this quarter for restructuring-related expenses. Cash burn guidance will be given during the Q4 earnings call.
    • Shares are down 3% after hours.
    • Previously: Astellas Pharma's DNA vaccine candidate flunks late-stage study in CMV-positive HSCT patients; licensor Vical down 22% premarket (Jan. 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts up 4.3% as Q3 revenues grow

    • Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) is up 4.3% after hours following Q3 earnings where net revenue inched up on a GAAP basis and the company guided slightly ahead of expectations on bookings.
    • Net revenue was $1.16B: digital net revenue of $780M (up 14%) and packaged goods/other net revenue at $380M (down 18%). Changed in deferred net revenue was $811M.
    • A net loss of $186M incorporated recognizing $176M in incremental income tax expense due to the new tax reform law.
    • In operations, the company noted its FIFA community grew to almost 42M players on console alone and FIFA Mobile added 26M players to its base in the quarter.
    • Battlefield 1 has accumulated more than 25M unique players, it says.
    • It's guiding to full-year net bookings of $5.15B (vs. expectations for $5.13B) and EPS of $3.25, accounting for an impact of about -$0.48/share due to applying the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 12 Comments
  • CERS

    Cerus readies $50M stock offering; shares down 9% after hours

    • Cerus (NASDAQ:CERS) launches a $50M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be released.
    • Shares are off 9% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • SYRS

    Syros Pharma readies $40M stock offering; shares down 11% after hours

    • Syros Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SYRS) launches a $40 public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are off 11% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • CHRW

    C.H. Robinson Worldwide beats by $0.24, beats on revenue

    • C.H. Robinson Worldwide (NASDAQ:CHRW): Q4 EPS of $1.08 beats by $0.24.
    • Revenue of $3.96B (+16.1% Y/Y) beats by $230M.
    • Shares +2.18%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALGN

    Align Technology Q4 top line up 44%; EPS down 78%; shares up 5% after hours

    • Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 421.3 (+43.7%).
    • Net Income: 10.3 (-78.4%); EPS: 0.13 (-78.0%).
    • Invisalign case shipments: 255K (+12.8%), average selling price: $1,230 (-2.8%).
    • 2018 Guidance: Revenues: $400M - 410M; EPS: $0.94 - 0.98; Invisalign case shipments: 264K - 269K.
    • Shares are up 5% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 38 Comments
  • CWLDF

    Wynn Resorts closes on Vegas Strip land sale

    • Crown Resorts (OTCPK:CWLDF, OTCPK:CWLDY) discloses that its majority-owned subsidiary Alon Las Vegas Resort completed the sale of its interest in a vacant piece of property on Las Vegas Boulevard to a subsidiary of Wynn Resorts (WYNN +4.8%).
    • The ~35-acre plot sits on the opposite side of Las Vegas Boulevard as Wynn Las Vegas and Wynn Encore.
    • Shares of Wynn Resorts staged a comeback today after a sharp two-day drop, closing up 4.84% to cross back over $170.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 4 Comments
  • FWONA

    Formula One, WWE up as Morgan Stanley praises media disruption

    • Liberty Formula One (NASDAQ:FWONA) is up 2.1% today after an upgrade to Overweight form Morgan Stanley, which sees a benefit from the disruption of direct-to-consumer service.
    • Last year was the year when TV on the Internet went "mainstream" and began structurally disrupting media companies, analyst Benjamin Swinburne notes.
    • That comes with increasing spending on subscription TV, a benefit for companies like Formula One and WWE -- also upgraded to Overweight and up 2.7% against a down market today.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 2 Comments

  • Oil prices sink as sentiment turns, 'was due for a correction'

    • Crude oil prices sank for a second straight session amid today's broad selloff of stocks, bonds and commodities, with U.S. March WTI -1.5% to settle at $64.50/bbl and March Brent -0.6% at $69.02.
    • Just last week crude oil hit three-year highs amid strong demand, geopolitical risks, a weaker U.S. dollar and OPEC-led supply curbs; now some analysts say investors are waking up to the effects of rising U.S. crude production.
    • “U.S. oil production is rising and forecasts have moved up,” says Ehsan Ul-Haq of Resource Economist Ltd. “Oversupply is becoming the problem... with more and more U.S. crude we are going to be drowning in oil.”
    • But investor enthusiasm for oil also has led to lopsided bets that may have made the market vulnerable to sharp selloffs, as hedge funds, pensions and other investors have amassed their largest-ever net bullish positions in U.S. crude futures.
    • “It’s gone up too far, too fast and was due for a correction,” says Michael Hiley, head of over-the-counter energy trading at LPS Futures LLC. “It’s a similar feeling to the stock market - both are running hard and both... are correcting.”
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, XES, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, IEZ, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 39 Comments
  • ABBV

    AbbVie, Lilly particularly vulnerable to BRK/AMZN/JPM venture - BMO

    • "Increased adoption of biosimilars will be one of the key drivers to lower drug costs," says analyst Alex Arfaei.
    • This poses risk for all drugmakers, but especially AbbVie (ABBV -5%), given its perky valuation and possible drug price erosion of 30%-50%.
    • Eli Lilly (LLY -1.8%) faces biosimilar threats to Humalog and its insulin franchise.
    • Source: Bloomberg's Bailey Lipschultz
    • Previously: Height weighs in on Amazon/Berkshire/JPMorgan healthcare venture (Jan. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 36 Comments
  • IDTI

    Integrated Device Tech drops after earnings, mixed Q4 forecast

    • Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI) drops following yesterday’s Q3 report. The company outlined its mixed Q4 guidance on the earnings call.
    • Q4 forecast: Revenue, $217M to $227M (consensus: $215M); EPS, $0.41 to $0.47 (consensus: $0.44); gross margin, 61.5% to 63.5%; non-GAAP operating margin, 30%; non-GAAP tax rate, 10%; operating expenses, decrease $1.7M; R&D, decrease $1M. 
    • Integrated Device shares are down 9.4%.        
    • Previously: Integrated Device Tech +4% after Q3 beats; guidance on conference call (Jan. 29)
    • Previously: Semiconductors down on Integrated Device earnings, Maxim acquisition denial (Jan. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 4 Comments
  • GOOG

    Judge says Waymo can't show financial projections in Uber trial starting next week

    • Judge William Alsup tells Waymo (GOOG, GOOGL) that its lawyers can’t present financial projections for the self-driving car market when its trial against Uber (UBER) starts next week.
    • Judge Alsup says the projections would improperly influence the jury and he wants the case focused on the eight trade secrets in the case. 
    • But he will allow Waymo to show Uber’s documents from its “Project Rubicon,” which contains Uber’s projections and material that will be introduced as evidence. 
    • Judge Alsup also told the two parties to come up with a matching timeline of events before the trial starts or he will publicly admonish the lawyers. 
    • The trial begins Monday, February 5 at 7:30 AM Pacific Time.  
    • Previously: Judge postpones Waymo trial after Uber "withheld evidence" (update) (Nov. 28, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 8 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (1/30/18)

    • Gainers: TRNS +13%. CALD +10%. EXTR +9%. IMMR +8%. PTI +7%.
    • Losers: MARK -17%. GIGM -9%. RUBI -9%. IDTI -9%. RMBS -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNHI

    CNH Industrial -3% after reporting weaker Q4 profit margins

    • CNH Industrial (CNHI -2.9%) is sharply lower after reporting a decline in Q4 operating profit margins for its industrial activities despite a 15% jump in sales.
    • CNH says Q4 operating profit for its industrial activities rose nearly 14% to $468M but margins fell to 6% from 6.2% in the year-ago quarter.
    • The maker of trucks and tractors issues downside guidance for FY 2018, seeing EPS of $0.63-$0.67 vs. $0.68 analyst consensus estimate on revenues of $27B-$28B vs. $28.07B consensus.
    • CNH expects worldwide demand for agricultural equipment to improve with all regions flat to 5% higheron average.
    • CNH also says it plans to launch a buyback program for up to $700M, $400M more than the current program.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel -13% as investors 'perplexed' on price guidance

    • AK Steel (AKS -13.2%) plunges to its lowest level in more than a month, despite initial gains after reporting a smaller than expected Q4 loss, amid investor concerns that rising costs will constrain margins even as prices gain.
    • AK Steel said in today's earnings conference call that it sees higher prices mitigating rising costs in 2018, guidance that Credit Suisse analyst Curt Woodworth says caused investors to be “pretty perplexed.”
    • “You’re getting pricing to cover costs, but that doesn’t mean you’re making a lot more money,” Woodworth tells Bloomberg. AKS "said they would cover raw material costs, but the point is you’re kind of running to stand still."
    • Woodworth says the “rubber meets the road” in Q2 because that’s when AKS will monetize spot business and get the bulk of remaining contracts booked.
    • Other steel producers also are sharply lower: X -5.7%, WOR -3.5%, NUE -3.3%, CMC -2.4%, MT -1.8%, STLD -1.1%.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 20 Comments
  • ALK

    JPMorgan cautious on Alaska Air Group

    • JPMorgan cuts Alaska Air Group (ALK -2%) to an Underweight rating.
    • "We applaud Alaska’s decision to temper 2019 growth in light of current fundamentals. But ALK is the only name where we've cut our 2019 forecast (as has consensus), and the company remains in the United crosshairs in San Francisco, in our view," warns analyst Jamie Baker.
    • Baker also calls ALK expensive compared to JetBlue, which caught a JP upgrade earlier today.
    • Previously: JPMorgan makes the case for JetBlue (Jan. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 5 Comments
  • AAPL

    Bloomberg: DOJ and SEC investigating Apple iPhone throttling

    • The U.S. Department of Justice and the Securities and Exchange Commission are investigating Apple’s (NASDAQ:AAPL) slowing of older iPhone models, according to Bloomberg sources.
    • The question is whether Apple violated securities laws by not disclosing that an early 2017 software update could throttle older devices with old or malfunctioning batteries.
    • Apple later apologized for not communicating the information, offered discount replacement batteries, and promised to release a software update to make battery information more transparent.
    • The government has requested information from Apple but sources say the inquiry is in early stages. 
    • Apple shares are down 1.1%. 
    • Previously: Apple's apology letter to consumers includes $29 batteries (Dec. 28, 2017)
    • Previously: Apple delaying some iOS updates; WSJ reports on iPhone X production cuts (Jan. 30)
    • Previously: Deutsche Bank: Apple consensus estimates still too high for Q1, Q2 (Jan. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 89 Comments
  • CMG

    Chipotle falls amid anecdotal food poisoning reports

    • Shares of Chipotle (CMG -5%) are down 5.05% with some reports of food poisoning making their way around.
    • There are anecdotal reports on Twitter and on the IWasPoisoned.com website that are drawing attention.
    • No mainstream media outlet has broken down details on an outbreak and the company hasn't issued a comment.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 26 Comments
  • NTES

    NetEase, Mattel form joint venture to bring toy brands online

    • NetEase (NTES -0.9%) and Mattel (MAT -1.7%) are forming a joint venture to collaborate on digital products, focused on mobile games.
    • The project, called Mattel163, will be divided 50-50 and develop content based on toy franchises including Barbie, Hot Wheels and Fisher-Price, and starting with a game based around Mattel's Uno card game early this year.
    • The move might bring a digital breakthrough for Mattel after previous tries; NetEase's online game division last year drew about $5.5B in sales, more than Mattel's total revenue of $5.1B.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 6 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (1/30/2018)

    • Gainers: TUSK +6%. USEG +5%.
    • Losers: OSN -18%. SMG -15%. PE -14%. LTBR -14%. AKS -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • AZRX

    AzurRx BioPharma up 13%

    • Thinly traded nano cap AzurRx BioPharma (AZRX +13.4%) perks up on almost a 4x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 171K shares.
    • No particular news accounts for the action but the company filed a prospectus for a $10M mixed shelf offering in October.
    • At end end of September 2017, it had $2.9M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed $1.3M.
    • Lead candidate is MS1819-SD for chronic pancreatitis.
    • Previously: AzurRx Bio's MS1819-SD shows treatment effect in mid-stage pancreatitis study; shares up (Sept. 27, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • HOV

    Hovnanian credit rating downgraded after debt swap

    • A judge yesterday declined an injunction request by Solus Alternative Asset Management, clearing the way for Hovnanian (HOV -4.8%) to exchange its 8% senior notes due this year for unsecured paper due in 2026 and 2040, along with $26.5M in cash.
    • Behind the deal is some fascinating inside baseball between Solus, Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and Hovnanian. This move combined with others means a big payout for CDSs held by Blackstone's GSO Capital. Solus is on the losing end of that bet.
    • For Hovnanian, it's getting a credit rating downgrade, but got very favorable longer-term financing (from Blackstone).
    • S&P cuts to SD (selective default) from CC.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • TRI

  • GERN

    Geron continues rally, up 15%

    • Micro cap Geron (GERN +14.5%) is up again today on a 5x surge in volume. Shares have rallied ~35% in two days.
    • Yesterday, SA Contributor MedTechBio published an article detailing the bullish thesis for lead candidate imetelstat, emphasizing that it is much more effective than Celgene's top seller Revlimid (lenalidomide) in myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) patients.
    • A key looming event is the decision from exclusive licensee Janssen to continue development after reviewing Phase 2 data.
    • Imetelstat inhibits an enzyme called telomerase by binding to its RNA template. Most cancers have a high level of telomerase activity and relatively short telemeres (caps at the end of each strand of DNA) compared to normal cells. Inhibiting telomerase inhibits the proliferation of malignant progenitor cells.

    • General Electric (GE -1.9%) resumes its downward pull - along with the broader market today - as Stifel cuts its stock price target to $17 from $18 citing the company's "messy, underwhelming" results reported last week.
    • Stifel's Robert McCarthy, who keeps his rating at Hold, says the continued challenges in GE's core power business and continued headline surprises, such as the disclosure of an SEC investigation, should weigh on the stock for a long time.
    • "Clearly, the fundamental turnaround of the core power biz is no easy quick fix, and the limited upside and transaction costs, and implicit GE Capital liability drag with a breakup are not compelling at all at these price levels in the $16 range," McCarthy writes.

  • SLDB

    Solid Biosciences slips on potential AAV toxicity

    • Today's broad market selloff notwithstanding, recent IPO Solid Biosciences (SLDB -11.4%) slumps on lower-than-normal volume in apparent response to the departure of noted gene therapy researcher James Wilson from its Scientific Advisory Board.
    • In a note, RBC speculates that his exit was due to concerns about the toxicity of the adeno-associated virus (AAV) vector commonly used to deliver gene therapies to cells, including Solid's lead candidate SGT-001.
    • Yesterday, Professor Wilson and his team published a paper detailing the toxicity of a high-dose intravenous-administered AAV vector in three rhesus macaques and three piglets. All experienced toxicity that led to the euthanization of one primate and all three piglets.
